source_sentence: 佛說如意摩尼陀羅尼經
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Wish-Fulfilling Gem

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚少卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra of the Buddha, Tathāgata, and Young Secretary of the Court

source_sentence: 傳法大師臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial decree by the Minister of the Transmission of the Dharma, Shihu
Thus I have heard.

source_sentence: 一時佛在舍衛國迦利哩城。
translation: One time, the Buddha was present in the city of Kalirī in Śrāvastī.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Venerable Ānanda.

source_sentence: 今有陀羅尼能除一切暴惡雷電。
translation: "Now, there's a dhāraṇī that can remove all violent thunder and lightning.
You must accept and uphold it.
This is the Sutra on the Merit of Seeking Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 過去如來應正等覺親所宣說。
translation: The Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One himself taught it in the past.
Now, I'll also explain it.
'Practice great compassion in this world.

source_sentence: 利益安樂天上人間一切有情。
translation: It benefits and pleases all sentient beings up in heaven or among humans.'
Ānanda said, "Yes, Bhagavān!
'May I wish to hear about it and accept it now.'
The Buddha told Ānanda, "You [should] know that there's a thunderbolt in the east named 'Thunderbolt.'

source_sentence: 當知東方有雷電名曰阿伽。
translation: "You should know that there's a thunderbolt in the east named Agha.

source_sentence: 南方有雷電名曰設帝嚕。
translation: In the south, there's a thunderbolt named Śetilu.

source_sentence: 西方有雷電名曰哆鉢囉(二合)婆。
translation: In the west, there's a thunderbolt named Dhavajra.

source_sentence: 北方有雷電名曰掃那摩儞。
translation: In the north, there's a thunderbolt named Soṇamānīya.

source_sentence: 阿難若有善男子善女人。
translation: Ānanda, suppose there are good sons and good women.

source_sentence: 知此雷電名號及住處方位。
translation: Knowing the name of this thunderbolt and the location of its abode.
All thunderbolts won't frighten that person.

source_sentence: 若所在之處書寫此雷電名號。
translation: If he writes down the name of this thunderbolt wherever he is, he'll uphold it and make offerings.
He memorizes it and makes offerings to it.
All thunderbolts won't harm him.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說此擁護真言章句。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke these words and phrases in support of the true teaching.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(引)儞彌儞彌儞彌孕(二合)馱哩(引)怛哩(二合)路(引)迦(引)路吉儞輸羅播(引)尼儞囉乞叉(二合)[牟*含](切身)薩哩嚩(二合)尾儞用(二合)婆曳(引)毘藥(二合)娑嚩(二合)賀(引)爾時聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩在大眾中。

He got up from his seat and put his palms together and pointed them at the Buddha.
He said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!
"Here, I was speaking the correct teaching.
I've also explained the phrase embracing the true teaching.

He went to the Buddha and bowed his head with his palms together.
He said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!
"Now, in the midst of the true teaching, I've also explained the dhāraṇī chapter of the true language.
I've also explained the phrase of the true dhāraṇī language.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(引)母儞母儞母儞摩帝母儞摩帝蘇摩帝摩賀(引)摩帝賀(引)賀(引)賀(引)賀(引)摩帶(引)哩曩(二合引)悉底(二合)帝(引)播(引)半嚩日囉(二合)播(引)尼囉憾涅哩(二合)茶娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)世尊我此陀羅尼。
translation: "Taneya (二合)他(引用)母沛母沛母沛母沛母沛摩帝母沛摩帝蘇摩帝摩賀(引)摩帝賀(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)贺(引)马帶(引)哩曩(二合引)Śeti (二合)帝(引)婆(引)半吾日囉(二合)婆離(引)尼囉憾尼里(二合)茶娑紗紗(二合引)世尊我此陀羅尼。
It's called the unsurpassed Dhāraṇī that protects sentient beings.
If someone writes it down and remembers it.

source_sentence: 所有一切恐怖及其中夭悉令解脫。
translation: All fears and their premature death will be liberated.'

source_sentence: 爾時大梵天王索訶世界主。
translation: It was then that the king of the Brahma heavens, the lord of the sohā world, said to the Buddha.
He said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!
"For the benefit of all sentient beings, I've explained the dhāraṇī in this right teaching.

source_sentence: 於此正法亦說陀羅尼真言章句。
translation: Here in the true teaching, I also explain the words and phrases of the dhāraṇī in their true language.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(引)呬隷彌隷唧隷娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)沒囉(二合)憾摩(二合)布哩(引)摩賀(引)沒囉(二合)憾摩(二合引)尼(引)沒囉(二合)憾摩(二合)誐哩鼻(二合引)補瑟波(二合)設娑哆(二合)哩娑嚩(二合引)賀世尊我此陀羅尼名梵天杖。
translation: 怛儞也(二合)他(引)呬隷彌隷唧隷娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)沒囉(二合)憾摩(二合)布哩(引)摩賀(引)沒囉(二合)憾摩(二合引)尼(引)沒囉(二合)憾摩(二合)誐哩鼻(二合引)補瑟波(二合)設娑哆(二合)哩娑嚩(二合引)賀世尊我此陀羅尼名梵天杖。
It protects all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 遠離中夭不生恐怖亦能除滅一切罪業。
translation: It's far removed from premature death, doesn't cause fear, and removes all wrongdoing.
It was then that Indra, the lord of the gods, went up to the Buddha and stood with his palms together and bowed his head.
He stood before the Buddha with his palms together and bowed his head in homage.
He said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!
"Now, here in the true Dharma, I also explain the dhāraṇī zhāngyāna.
I've also explained the phrase of the dhāraṇī true language.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(引)沒馱麼(引)旦膩(引)麼(引)儞儞憍(引)哩巘(引)馱(引)哩贊拏隷摩(引)鄧詣布訖嚩(二合)悉娑(引)羅沒囉(二合)帝(引)呬曩末馱用(二合)哆羅尼滿覩(引)隷儞計(引)作迦囉(二合)嚩(引)枳舍嚩哩舍(引)嚩哩娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)世尊我此陀羅尼名金剛座。
translation: "Taneya (二合)他(引)没馱么(引)旦膩(引)麼(引)尼尼滿tu(引)尼 尼赏ゃん(引)逵 peak(引)馱(引)rizānapuṇḍar(引)鄧詣布婆婆婆婆搔(二合)Śeṣa(引)羅沒囉(二合)帝(引)賀(引)世尊我这个陀羅尼名金剛座。
It frees him from all fears and dreads.
It's far removed from all medium-length deaths.

source_sentence: 爾時持國天王增長天王廣目天王多聞天王俱詣佛前合掌頂禮。
translation: It was then that the Dhāraṇī holding god king, the Virūḍhaka god king, the Virūḍhaka god king, and the Vaiśravaṇa god king both approached the Buddha with their palms together and bowed their heads.
They said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!
"We are here in the true Dharma.
We also spoke the words and phrases of the true dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他補瑟閉(二合引)蘇補瑟閉(二合引)度波波哩賀(引)哩(引)阿(引)哩也(二合)鉢囉(二合)設悉帝(二合引)扇(引)帝(引)儞哩目(二合)訖帝(二合引)夢誐隷曳(二合)呬囉拏也(二合)誐哩鼻(二合引)娑覩(二合)帝(引)娑哆(二合)尾帝(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀世尊我等四大天王作說陀羅尼名為無怖。
translation: "Tanniya (二合)塔補瑟閉(二合引)蘇補瑟閉(二合引)杜波波哩賀(引)里(引)阿(引)里也(二合)鉢囉(二合)設悉帝(二合引)扇(引)帝(引)报(引)报(报)乃里目(二合引)乃里目(二合引)报(二合引)卍ga (二合引)姨(二合引)鷹羅拏(二合)鷹羅拏(二合)賀世尊We four great celestial kings create and preach a dhāraṇī called fearlessness.
They are able to bestow fearlessness in response to their fears.
They'll keep them far from dying in the interim and prolong their lives.
At the time, there was also a great ocean dragon king.

source_sentence: 所謂大意龍王雷光龍王。
translation: They're called the dragon king of great intent, the dragon king of thunderbolts, and the dragon king of electric tongues.

source_sentence: 無熱惱龍王電舌龍王百光龍王。
translation: They were the dragon king of no-hotness, the dragon king of the electric tongue, and the dragon king of a hundred lights.

source_sentence: 俱詣佛所合掌頂禮白佛言世尊。
translation: They all went to the Buddha, put their palms together, bowed their heads, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!
"Bhagavān, I have a dhāraṇī named 'wish-granting jewel.'
It protects sentient beings.
If someone writes it down and recites it, it can remove all fears of thunder and lightning.
It can remove all fears of thunder and lightning.

source_sentence: 一切中夭一切諸毒一切惡病。
translation: All medium-length deaths, all poisons, and all bad diseases.

source_sentence: 及不吉祥鬼神亦不得便。
translation: Unlucky spirits and ghosts won't be able to get help.
Bhagavān, if you uphold this true teaching.

source_sentence: 我等龍類悉皆悲愍不生嫉妬。
translation: "We dragons are all compassionate and don't become jealous.

source_sentence: 於意云何龍趣之類行嫉妬心。
translation: What do you think about that? What kind of dragons and their destinies are filled with jealousy?
If they hear this teaching, they won't become jealous.'
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(引)阿惹哩(引)摩摩哩(引)阿蜜哩(二合)帝(引)阿訖叉(二合)曳(引)阿尾也(二合)曳(引)奔尼也(二合)鉢哩也(二合)曳(引)薩哩嚩(二合)播(引)波鉢囉(二合)舍摩儞娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)阿哩也(二合)奔拏燥(引)播(引)枳曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀印捺囉(二合引)舍儞曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)彌(引)伽(引)舍儞曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時世尊聞彼大梵天王天帝釋護世四天王及大龍王等說此陀羅尼。
translation: "After hearing this dhāraṇī from the king of the Brahmā gods, the four heavenly guardian kings and the great dragon kings, the Bhagavān heard them say, 'Good, good!'
They praised him, saying, "Good, good!
It'll give many people great medicine for their well-being.
All of you should protect and popularize the right teaching.
After the Buddha spoke this sūtra.

source_sentence: 一切大眾天龍阿修羅乾達婆等。
translation: All the masses of gods, dragons, asuras, goddesses, and others rejoiced and believed and handed it down.
They all rejoiced greatly and faithfully accepted and handed it down.

source_sentence: 佛說如意摩尼陀羅尼經
translation: Foshuo ruyi moi tuoluoni jing
